messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Alan Rickman Fans
messages.msgSnippet: ... Gosh, I m sorry.  Maybe its just an AOL thing. It was a celebrity look a like thing.  This guy was a twin of Alan Rickman..I mean UNCANNY.. and I also
messages.messageBody:
> > Ack, "page not found." Don't tease me like that!!
>
Gosh, I'm sorry. Maybe its just an AOL thing. It was a celebrity look a like thing. This guy was a twin of Alan Rickman..I mean UNCANNY.. and I also noticed some messages on the "feedback" message board on AOL about Alan Rickman.

Reese

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Alan Rickman Fans
messages.msgSnippet: Heh, heh.  Alan is noticeably absent from my life when Ross is home.  But when he s away (like he is now), I get to pant, just a bit.  It s not just his looks
messages.messageBody:
Heh, heh. Alan is noticeably absent from my life when Ross is home. But
when he's away (like he is now), I get to pant, just a bit. It's not just
his looks (which are perhaps...hmmm....an acquired taste), but his manner,
his wit, his "dangerous" quality. Hey, I guess that's what I like about my
husband, too <g>.

Robin B.

> > Ack, "page not found." Don't tease me like that!!
>
> This from the woman whose husband is much nicer to look at than Alan
> Rickman. (*Look at*, Robin, just look at) <g>
> Tia
